intro: Allium callidyction, commonly known as the Greek garlic, is a bulbous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, rounded bulbs that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, stocky stem. Allium callidyction is typically found in rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
